Fig. 6a, Rub alone without any cocatalyst in the reaction shows poor generation rate of CO and H 2 .With 0.1 mg Co 0.85 Se added, the produced CO and H 2 are significantly enhanced to 24.6 and 6.6 mol in 1 h reaction, respectively, indicating that Co 0.85 Se remarkably promoted the photocatalytic CO 2 reduction, as a heterogeneous cocatalyst.The cocatalytic effect of Co 0.85 Se could be attributed to the activation of CO 2 molecules and the fast transfer of photoelectrons on the surface of Co 0.85 Se

than 0.1 mg, while it turned into the electron-transfer kinetics once the co-catalyst was more than 0.1 mg 33,35.Note that the total generation of CO and H 2 stays nearly unaltered when an excessive amount of Co 0.85 Se added, further confirming electron transfer from the sensitizer as the rate determining step.All these results highlight the dual functions of Co 0.85 Se in promoting CO 2 reduction acting as a CO 2 absorber and a redox promoter. result.query:
Please find the category of Light_source and Lamp from the provided context which describe an solar chemical experiment.
The generation condition of the extraction is given: If Light_source is Solar or Solar Simulator, Lamp is always Solar Simulator.

Light_source: ['UV', 'Solar', 'UV-Vis', 'Monochromatic', 'Solar Simulator']
